text: Through massive sun flare, a BLACKHAWK Chopper coming in fast. Landing hard on Bagram Air Base.

(vo) It’s something most of us have known all of our lives. What we all wanted. It’s in our blood. A team of medical personal and Navy officers descend on t chopper. An assortment of high-ranking GENERALS and COMMANDING OFFICERS there to meet the chopper. Tight shot A bloody hand dangles. A tear filled eyeball, sliced feet LUTTRELL (CONT’D) (vo) There’s a storm inside of us. I’ve heard many team guys speak of this. A burning. A river. A drive.
Clothes cut. Blood soaked Dog Tags cut. “Luttrell” in UA boxer shorts, IVs and fresh blood bags. Multiple Gunshots Chunk of an ear missing. Heartbeat monitor. Weak pulse.

(vo) An unrelenting desire to push yourself harder and further than anyone could think possible. Chunks of bullet and shrapnel filling metal bowl. Tears streaming down cheeks, a hand scrawled map on a left thig focused eyes of surgeons. Admirals’ pace in the hallway. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) (vo) Pushing ourselves into those dark cold corners where the bad things live. Where the bad things fight. Heart monitor weak. Getting weaker. Compound fracture lef shin. Bloody feet rinsed clean. Water flushing out bullet holes. Loose cracked tooth pulled out. Heart monitor gett weaker. Surgical pack working franticly to save Luttrell. Tight on HEART MONITOR: FLATLINE

LUTTRELL CONT’D We wanted that fight at the highest volume. The loud fight. The loudest, coldest, hottest, most unpleasant of the unpleasant fights. Pushing in on the flatline. Alarm screaming. Tight on Luttrell’s eyes starting to glaze over. Dying. BLACK.
“FIVE DAYS EARLIER”
Rugged and punishing. Endless and infinite. Steep stone mountains. Bottomless valleys. Cold and dry. As we fly across this stunning land, from the bottom of t
FOUR HELICOPTERS. Two MH-47s transport. Two security Apac
TIGHT ON MARCUS LUTTRELL. Healthy and very clear eyed. 12 SEALs fully dressed for combat. Sitting side by side. Clearly ready for war.
Seen from above. Cruising at 150 over the shoulder of a . cal TF-160 aviator door gunner.
Riding low and fast. Inside: Two Night Stalker Pilots, Tw Airmen, and 12 SEALs.
The Choppers tearing across the Afghan mountains.
Luttrell checks his map against his wrist strapped GPS. Whistles quietly to himself.
I don’t see anything but steep. I could be wrong. Hope I’m wrong. If it’s anything but steep I’m not seeing it.

Just put your feet where I put my feet. All day long. You’re gonna love it. SHANE PATTON plugged into an iPod. SLIPKNOT pounding into head. He quietly sings along. Kristensen leans over to Axelson, the navigator, adjusts upper right strap on his front pack.
I'm real interested in the pitch. If it ain’t fucking glorious, come back, try another route. Don’t waste your time trying to cross something that’s gonna knock the shit out of us.
Roger that. Kristensen moves over to MIKE MURPHY.
She does not need a Arabic horse.
How do you know about that?
I know everything Murphy.
Check.
Morab Tennessee Walking Horse cross stallion.
What?  3A.
Original Silver. Lone Ranger's Horse.
Really?
Tennessee cross stallion. That’s a fucking horse.
Yes sir.
Lone Ranger’s horse of choice.
Sounds excellent sir.
Glorious horse Murphy. Tight on Luttrell starring into the plunging sun.

INTERCUT AFGHAN VILLAGE. Intro Afghan warlord. AHMAD SHAH 35 years old. Tall, strong. Fierce. He moves through an Afghan village with a small pack of equally fierce Taliba warriors. LOCAL AFGHANS avoid eye contact. This Shah and crew feel like an old school western bad guy moving through a cow t NOTHING like the SUICIDE BOMBERS of BAGDAD. These are rea warriors. Strong-jawed. Thin but ripped muscles. Worn ric soulful faces, vivid eyes, color reds and blues. Strong boots. Military vests. Good radio equipment. Well-maintai weapons. Shah’s number two is TARAQ. Late twenties. Shah is viciou TARAQ, is more vicious. Strong and very, very violent. A very worthy opponent. RIGHT now they are clearly pissed. Shah leads the way, wa with purpose. They are looking for a man. Someone has violated TALIBAN accused of aiding the Americans. Shah moves into a house. Women and children terrified. Trembling. Women pleading.

Where is he? Hagha Cherta Dey? The women scream. As Shah starts throwing teenage boys ar the room. Slamming them viciously into walls. A 25-year-old man Gulab tries to reason with Shah. A YOUN BOY watches.

Please, we want no trouble. Mehrabani/lutfan, monga hes mushkil no ghowaro Taragq throws Gulab down hard. Turns, locks eyes with an Afghan man(30s). Taraq moves quickly at him, kicking him the face, his foot down hard on his throat.
Have you spoken with the Aya taso Americayano sara Americans? khaberi keri dey?
Please! No! Mehrabani/lutfan! Na! Gulab watches. Frustrated. Furious.
You lie! Ta Dorogh wayee!
Please! Mehrabani/lutfan!

He’s pressing down hard. Choking the man. The man’s famil begs and screams. Shah studies the Afghan deep into his e Decides he’s lying...Shah nods to Taraq. Taraq yanks the Afghan to his feet. As his children watch Taraq leads the pleading farmer outside. Into the woods. Taragq and his men throw the Afghan down over a fallen lo Face up. Two of Taraq’s men hold him by the beard as Taraq stands him. Razor sharp machete up. Shah backlit. Ignoring the man’s pleading...as Taraq hack down with brutal fury. Tight on Shah, tight on Taraq, blood dripping from his ha

Sun just beginning to rise over the Base. Beautiful. Camera moves though the sleeping base. Guards man posts. Aircraft static on runways in Hangars’. Tent after tent soldiers’ sleep. We come to a small base within a base. 10 foot rebar fram dirt walls. Barbed wire. Heavy Iron gate. A fortress within a fortress. Graphic.

head_text.subj: SEAL TEAM 10 CAMP OUELLETTE, BAGRAM AIR BASE

text: We move inside the SEAL compound. Several plywood buildin Assorted trucks, Jeeps, heavy ATVs.
Marcus Luttrell sleeps. Peaceful. Tight shots. Luttrell’s room. A Texas flag. Family pictures. Mom, Dad, twin Broth Morgan. SEAL Trident. Wanted poster Osama bin Laden. Guns knifes, grenades.

DANNY DIETZ sleeps. His walls covered with his art. Demon and Dragons and Serpents. Beautiful and haunting. Picture his wife, Patsy. His dogs. His parents. Matt Axelson sleeps. Curly red hair. Pictures of his fami American flag. Freddie Couples walking the bridge at St. Andrews. Map of Afghanistan.

Rooms a mess. Clothes and gear everywhere. Grenades on a next to a copy of GATES OF FIRE. New York Rangers flag ne to a SEAL Flag, 8 x 10 head shot of Ron Burgundy. Tight on Murphy. His eyes slowly open. Hold a moment. Mur checks watch. 0500. Slow and smooth Murphy rises. Body strong. Not ripped. Effortless power. Murphy goes to his computer. Opens it and checks his mail Tight on Murphy’s inbox. A picture of an Arabian Horse. Murphy studies the picture

Murphy now in shorts and a Navy T-shirt. Holding his lapt eating a banana. Stops by Luttrell’s door. Opens it. Luttrell sleeps, Murphy sits on his bed. Nudges Luttrell. Luttrell opens an eye. He’s staring at the computer pic o Arabian horse.
Is this doable?
Expensive.
How much?
Arabic. She’s got good taste.
How much?
I'll find out. Expensive. Murphy is up. Heads out the door. Moves into the hallway. Opens Dietz’s door.  10
(quiet) Danny. Dietz. Eyes closed.
I’m up.

Dark, then lights on, revealing a decent cross fit style Blackboard filled with the current workout leaders. Dietz Murphy hold most of them. The two men start to stretch in silence. Luttrell wanders in. A giant bowl of cereal.
Since when does she want an Arabic horse?
Since I got an email this morning. Probably saw it on Oprah.
Oprah rides Arabic horses?
I don’t know what Oprah does.
She can afford them.
Why? How much do they cost?
I don’t know. Oprah money.
Fuck.

I thought you guys were doing this tomorrow. Murphy and Dietz strap on Body Armor.  11 LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Maybe I’m starting to become tele fucking pathic - non-verbal yoda or something. I could swear I just said outloud, that I thought this was happening tomorrow. Murphy stretching.
I think Red Wings a go. Tonight.
Oh. (beat) Outstanding. SHANE PATTON wanders in.
You're doing it now? The three men ignore Shane. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) (to Luttrell) They’re going at it now?

Looks that way. INT. MATT AXELSON’S BUNK - MORNING 11 Axe sleeps. His computer alarm goes off. Incoming voice c Slowly Axe reaches down for the computer on his floor. Axe opens the computer. Signs in. Incoming from his wife Cindy. “Bre you up?” Axe types. “Yes my love.” Cindy. “What you doing?” Axe stares at a picture of he and Cindy.  12 13
“Looking at you.”
How do I look?
Like Heaven.
Dietz and Murphy both warmed up clearly ready for some ki of competition. Luttrell sits on a weight bench. Takes off his watch. Dietz and Murphy under pull up bars. HEALY enters.
Thought you guys were doing this tomorrow...
Ready?
Yup.

Mark. Set. Go. Luttrell hits the stop watch. Murphy and Dietz leap to bars, 75 Pull-ups as fast as possible. Brief pauses to recover. 100 push ups. Dietz slightly ahead of Murphy. Sprints out of the gym. Murphy close behind. The two men charge up and over the gate. Body Armor on. EXT. BAGRAM - MONTAGE -— MORNING 13 Murphy and Dietz running hard racing each other on a two lap of the Air Base. Luttrell keeps time. Shane starts bench pressing. Luttrell eats cereal. AXE in bunk room. On the computer with Cindy. 13A  “I won't be able to talk for a couple of days.” “Gotta go to work?” 9A.  14 10. “Got to pay the bills.” Murphy and Dietz sprinting. Dead even. Past Marines. Down runway full of active aircraft and helicopters.
Shane benching big. Luttrell munches cereal. Healy doing pushups.
Am I going?
No idea
I don’t know.
You know.
If I say I don’t know. I don’t know.
You know.
If you go you'll go. If you don’t go, trust me you will go. Eventually. Comprende?
So, I’m not going?
I didn’t say that.
You said if you don’t go, you will eventually go.
Yea, that’s not saying your not going.
I’m not going. Shane back to bench pressing. Luttrell checks his watch, heads out towards the gate.  10A.

Other SEALs starting to gather. JAMES SUH, DAN HEALY, MIK MCGREEVY, JAQUES FONTAN, JEFF LUCAS and JEFF TAYLOR  11. Dietz and Murphy balls out sprinting. Murphy has him by a feet coming back to Ouellette iron wall. Murphy throws op the gate, runs inside. Dietz a second behind. Luttrell looks at his watch.
Murphy by 1.1. Exhausted Dietz and Murphy sit in the dirt. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Head shave?
Fuck. Axe walks up, shorts and flip flops.
Who won?
Murphy. Barely.
Head shave? Dietz looks pained.
Man...I got to think this one out. If I shave his head, I’m going to have to look at him. Really look at him. Ears, face, funny shaped head...I don’t know. Marcus? What do you think?
I don’t know boss...I don’t want to be looking at him that close either, but he has been running his mouth about beating you...a lot. Head shave is fair.
Axe?
Hell yea, I say shave him, and he can’t eat with us, make him eat with E3 Marines until it grows back. Shave the boy.
Shane?

Well, I could go both ways on this. He did lose but, he was close and you're Mike Murphy and I would have expected a much bigger separation. Plus, we’re at war and there’s the whole Samson thing, so I’m not sure. I'll plead the fifth on this one. Murphy looks stares at Shane. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) But you’re the boss, boss. So I’m with you. I’ll shave his head, wax his balls if you give me the order. Sir, I'll wax my own balls if you take me on Red Wings. Murphy shakes his head at Patton, looks over to Dietz.
Come on Mike.
Yea Danny this is probably not gonna go your way. Shane, get my razor.
Getting razor, copy that. Erik Kristensen, officer in charge, from the deck of the Command Room. Shane stops. Turns around.
Not today. The SEALs stare up at their boss.
Red Wing’s a go. Today. 1800.  15 13.
Am I going?
(ignoring Shane) PLO in one hour.
Sir? Kristensen dead eyes Patton. Turns and heads back into TO Healy follows
Shane's going?
I don’t think so. Maybe. They all walk inside.
Thirty SEALs plus support packed into the TOC (Tactical Operational Command). Makeshift control center. PowerPoin flat screen. Operation REDWING is dissected.
Operation Red Wings. The target is Ahmad Shah and his, we are estimating ten men, “loyal amigos”. Including, this dude, Slide shifts to a color photo of “Taraq”.
Only have a first name, Taraq. Seems to do most of the chief shit for Shah. SEALs study photos.
We're going in with a four man team. The recon team is Dietz, Comms. Axe, Nav. Luttrell, Medic.
Objective of this mission is to positively identify Ahmad Shah. Shane’s head in his hands, pissed he is not going...a gra photo of Ahmad Shah on a large color monitor. PowerPoint.  13A.
This is the best picture we have of him. It’s current. (MORE )

We know Shah killed fourteen Marines last Tuesday in Kandahar. We just pulled this video off three different Tali web sights. It will in fact be a glorious day when Ahmad Shah and his good friend Taraq are no longer members of our human community. Clear video of Shah executing a Taliban woman. Two men ho her down. Shah fires an AK-47. The bullet kicking up dust it blasts through her skull into the dirt. The SEALs study this footage. Dead serious.
Go back...freeze. Axe studies an image of Shah.
No earlobes.
What’s that?
The guys got no earlobes. Silence as the team studies the image.
What are earlobes for anyway?
Piercing and balance.
Balance.
I heard earlobes are key for head balance - equilibrium. Cut a guys ear off, he’s gonna suck on a drunk test, balance beam, tight rope...
False. Earlobes have no biological functions for humans. Fish can use earlobes like a valve to open or close the ear canal.  14~A.
Why would a fish want to let water into his ear canal? Luttrell shoots him a look - “shut the fuck up”  15. Murphy keeps things moving.

Bad guy. Senior Taliban commander responsible for killing Marines in Eastern Afghanistan and sport killing civilians in the Hindu- Kush. Considered Tier One target rumored to be close to Bin Laden. Axe is going to go over our route in.

The helo pilots are going to do two false inserts. Then drop us off at our primary insert, located here. Secondary insert located here. From our primary insert, our bearing will be zero three zero patrolling 1.5 kilometers to our designated lay up point. We will be moving up the backside of this mountain which will offer us good concealment from the target but the terrain is gonna be rocky so watch your footing. I’m estimating it’s gonna take us about two hours to complete.
Luttrell - medical

First things first, win the fight. There’s no medicine in a gunfight. It’s self aid, buddy aid, corpsman aide. Two weeks ago, Team 3 was near where you guys will be. Capelli got bit by a rattlesnake. and contrary to popular belief, there is poison oak, so watch the cock and balls cause that will suck. Drink lots of water, wear sunscreen, and Dietz bring your own chapstick. Dietz stands up, starts talking comms
Crypto will be wide band, segment 2- 4. Murph’s got a SAT phone. Region is very steep so expect typical comms problems. We’1ll be on two hour comms windows. (MORE )
If we miss two windows I'd say wake somebody up. Other than that, don’t sweat it. Murphy picks up a plastic AC-130 and holds it over the ma
Ac-130 is with us?  16. Dietz takes the plane from Murphy. Moves it over the map.

Correct. Just for the infil. All comms will be relayed through the AC-130, call sign Apollo. Suns up, she’s out. Some of the key pro- words - when we have a successful insert, Budweiser. When we’re halfway through infil, it’1ll be Corona. At our observation point, Schlitz Malt Liquor. And if we positively identify Shah: touchdown. Danny chucks the toy plane.
Reaction Force is the following: The 47’s will relocate to J-Bad overnight. Murphy uses toy plastic helicopters to explain the size a location of the QRF.

That’s correct. You'll have fifteen team guys, and about a dozen Marines standing by all night. When we hear Schlitz Malt Liquor, we're heading back to Bagram for phase 2. QRF will stay here - we’re leaving you with 4 team guys, 20 marines, 2 Blackhawks and 2 Apaches. The Apaches stay with the Blackhawks. The toy Choppers circle on the map giving us a clear understanding of the playing field.

The movement is so we can get the 47's back here and be ready to bring it for phase two once you get eyes on Shah. Remember - comms will most likely be intermittent and there are reports that non- combatants are being used as recon elements for the enemy.
Roger that. Luttrell spits chew. Danny doodles furious, mashing demon Axe quietly studies the picture of Ahmad Shah.

head_text.subj: JAG GOES OVER RULES OF ENGAGEMENT

text: Lotta moving parts.
What we do, when we do, what we do.
We go in four hours. I’m pulling up tomorrow's new guy presentation to 1800 tonight so that all may revel and partake.
Are you serious?
Yes. Glorious evening gentlemen.

The four SEALS moving through the massive base. Long hair bearded. Surfers with handguns stuck in waistbands. Sharp contrast to the hundreds of uniformed buzz-cutted Rangers Marines. They move at us, holding trays loaded with food.
Murphy, Luttrell, Axe and Dietz. Eating. Having a fly cat and kill competition. DIETZ looks stressed. He’s got a paint tile sample page on the table in front o him. Studying paint samples.
We were gonna wait but she’s all into it and when she gets her head into something, that’s it. There’s no stopping her.  17A.
So just let her do it. It’s good for her. You got a handy man woman. That’s good.  18. MURPHY kills a fly. Places the dead fly by his coffee cup next to three other dead flies.
I don’t know.
Don’t know what?
I don’t know.
What?
He’s worried that he’s losing control over his castle.
Really.
Ask him.
Are you worried that you're losing control over your castle?
Shut up Murph.
Are you?
He’s having control issues cause he’s the one whose always made the “taste” issues in the family.
She’s got great taste. I trust her.
So what’s the problem?
It’s not a problem. It’s just very ongoing. Know what I mean? Luttrell kills a fly. He’s got six dead ones. He and Murp are competing.  19.
Not really. No. Marcus, you know what he means?
Control issues.
Is that right?
No.
Yes.
It’s not control issues.
What is it?
New grass leads to new bushes by the window, leads to new windows, leads to new curtains, leads to new sofa, leads to new rug, leads to new floor...
Got it.
Loss of control. Got to let that go bro.
It’s like this weird journey that she’s on. Moving through the house one room to the next.
Where is she now?
Kitchen. I think. Murphy and Luttrell both kill flies at the same time. Mar with Buzz cuts in crisp uniform eating all around the SEA Stark contrast.  18 20.

Tight on Shane Patton. Doing his best Napoleon Dynamite dance. He is not good. SEALS in lounge chairs. They watch laugh and taunt. Music loud. Shane powers through. Finish strong. Whistles and clapping from the SEALS. AXE stands up. Puts arm around Patton.
God was that awful

Ok, here’s the deal. That sucked, but I’m voting that we move him forward cause I can’t watch this shit without puking anymore so I say lest be done with it. All in favor? Luttrell and all SEALs put their hands up, except Murphy.
Come on Mikey.
Can he say it? Other SEALS agree. Shouting out. Debating whether Shane c “say it”. Making bets. AXE knows what Murphy is thinking. Pauses. Looks at Shane
(quiet to Shane) Can you say it?
I think so.
Think so?
I can say it.  21.
Ok. Shut up. Shut the fuck up. He can say it. Shut up. The room silences. Patton, nervous, takes a deep breath.

(weak, then strong) I’ve been around the world twice, talked to everyone once. I’ve seen two whales fuck, been to three world fairs, and I even know a man in Thailand with a wooden cock. I’ve pushed more peter, more sweeter, and more completer than any other peter-pusher around. Tight on the SEALS smiling, some mouthing the words along with Shane. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) I am a hard-bodied, hairy-chested, rootin, tootin, shootin, parachutin, demolition double cap crimping Frogman.
The entire SEAL TEAM jocks up. Gets ready.

(vo) There ain’t nothing I can’t do. No sky too high, no sea too rough, no Muff too tough. I’ve learned a lot of lessons in my life. Never shoot a large caliber man with a small caliber bullet. FLASH BURST IMAGES of all relevant equip, men being prepp M4s, night vision goggles, hand guns, knives, scopes chec Under Armor, PowerBars, water bottles, grenades, extra am radio's prepped, extra batteries, Laptops. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) (vo) I drive all kinds of trucks. 2x’'s, 4x's, 6x's even those big mother fuckers that bend and go TSSHITT TSSHITT when you step on the brakes. (MORE )

20 22. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) Anything in life worth doing is worth overdoing. Moderation is for cowards. DIETZ checking his radio equipment. AXE going over his infil map. LUTTRELL double checking all medical supplies. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) (vo) I'ma lover, I’m a fighter, I'ma UDT/SEAL Diver. I'll wine, dine, intertwine and then sneak out the back door when the refueling is done. MURPHY watching all of it. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) If your feeling froggy than you better jump because this Frogman has been there, done that and is going back for more.

Sun setting over the Afghan desert. Thirty SEALs laying o the deck on their gear. Chilling out waiting for the 47's The guys laying around. Danny studies a piece of paper wi color tile samples printed on it.
Seems to me like you’ve got to straighten this shit out.
There’s nothing to straighten out.
If there’s nothing to straighten, why are you fighting?
We're not fighting?
Well, what is it that you’re doing?
We're more like disagreeing.  23.
Disagreeing or arguing?
Probably more like mildly arguing. Just because you’re Mr. Perfect marriage, don’t be judging us mortal marriages who occasionally have mild disagreements, sometimes even loving arguments.
It’s a fucking stupid loving argument.
It’s not an argument.
It is an argument. Sounded like a couple of bighorn rams smashing skulls.
What the fuck is everyone listening to my shit for?
Bro, you’re loud.
You're louder than I am.
Just pick some tile and move the fuck on.
I picked the tile. She doesn’t like it.
What does she fucking like?
(reading from paper) “Rose Honey Dew”
Say what bro?
She likes rose honey dew...something.  24.
Are you fucking kidding me?
That’s what she likes.
You gotta control that situation.
Rose tiles in the kitchen?
Can we talk about something else?
Yea let’s talk about what she’s gonna tile your bathroom in.
I don’t wanna talk about that.
(Ron Burgandy impersonation) Danny? I’m gonna put it out there, if you like it, you can take it, if you don’t, send it right back. Dietz stares at Murphy. MURPHY (CONT’D) I wanna be on you.
I wanna be on you.
(pointing at Dietz) On you. Dietz smiles. Axe huge smile. Chopper engines grow louder. 47's back lit, coming in.
Let’s pack it up The SEALs start gearing up. Tight on guys, stoic. Choppers land. SEALs muster up and start boarding.  21
Back to close up of Luttrell, back to real time. 24A. 21
The choppers flying north into the setting sun, into the Hindu Kush. Chopper pilot POV, pushing deep into the mountains.
Now approaching a steep hill top.
(on radio) Good. Hold front, hold left, hold right, hold rear. The chopper is dangerously close to tree tops. Tucked int tiny opening.
Tight on LUTTRELL. DIETZ. MURPHY. AXE The team ready to move, up and at the door, when... from cockpit.

(on radio) Ropes. Ropes. Ropes. Fast rope dropped. Chopper jet engines screaming, the fou Opp SEALs up. The remaining twenty will be relocated and stand by as QRF. Axe up and out first, then Danny, Murphy out into the black night. Luttrell last one, hand on the rope, fist pounds Shane.
Next one Shane.
Have fun you lucky bastard.

As the four SEALs drop fast, land smooth. Luttrell last. The Chopper pulls up fast and is gone in seconds leaving four SEALS alone in the dead quiet, pitch black. NIGHT goggles lowered. The four quickly spread and drop into a STOP. LOOK. LISTE  25A. SILENT.  25 26 26. SEALs breathing.
Silent. Wind and the faint howling of wolves. Dietz quietly keys his mic.
Apollo 22, Spartan 01.
The AC-130 banking 15,000 ft above the team.
Spartan 01 Apollo 22, good comms. Were with you for six hours. Have a nice walk.
Apollo 22 Spartan 01 copy.

Tight on Murphy following Danny. Agile, despite the extra pounds of comm weight back-strapped. Luttrell - Foot down on loose granite. Pitch brutal. Left foot buckles. Slate shears. Falls. Slides. Flips. Lands o feet. He’s back on his feet. Axe pauses. Looks back smiling.
(on radio) Having fun Marcus?
(on radio) You picked this route to torture us didn’t you?
(on radio) Negative.
I picked it to torture Luttrell.
27 28 27. Luttrell, too big for this pitch. Slips again.

I’m gonna kill you. A series of shots tracking the SEAL’s rough hike to their lookout. Axe leads navigating with his GPS. At each of the four waypoints, Danny radios pro words: Budweiser, Corona, Heineken.
Kristensen, Patton, Musselman and the QRF tracking the te movement across the mountain range. SEALs reach lookout destination late, the sun is up. Sunrise.

The team finally makes it to their planned observation sp Murphy is the first to have binoculars up and is looking hill, way down hill at the Afghan village. 2,000 ft., ver steep, cliff like. Below them.

100 stone and wood homes, well-constructed. Looks almost charming. A couple of dozen Afghan villagers in different parts of the village, kids playing, women cooking, two me working on a roof. Looks quite peaceful. Left: trying to see the rest of the village. Can’t get a view, a mountain is blocking his view. Danny has the radio out and is calling in the arrival pro word.
(on radio) Beastmaster, this is Spartan 01, radio check.
In the TOC, SGT HASSLERT takes the call from Dietz. Heavy static. Weak signal.
Spartan 01, this is Beastmaster. I have you weak but readable
Beastmaster, this is Spartan 01. I pass Schlitz Malt liquor. How copy? Really weak signal.
Spartan 01 this is Beastmaster. Say again your last - you are weak and unreadable.
Beastmaster, this is Spartan 01. I pass Schlitz Malt Liquor, how copy.

Spartan 01, this is Beastmaster. Good copy. Hasslert looks to Kristensen. HASSLERT (CONT’D) Sketchy comms, sir. Spartan 01 has arrived. Erik Kristensen sitting. Nods. Gets up. Checks the wall clock: 6:45 AM
Ok. He stretches, cracks his back, looks to a couple of SEALs manning the TOC.
Later fellas. Night, night. Track out the door with Kristensen, as he, Shane, and Hea step out of the TOC into the bright Afghan sunshine.
Glorious day. Kristensen and all but four SEALs head to the waiting 47' start boarding. Kristensen looks to Musslemen, a SEAL who is staying with QRF.  29 30 29.
All yours brother.
Roger that Skipper. Kristensen boards his 47 and the two choppers lift off heading back to Bagram. Two Blackhawks and two Apaches standing by on the tarmac.
Axelson and Luttrell together, spotting scopes out, they study the village.
Can’t see half the village.
Yea. They study the surrounding area.
Let’s move down towards that peak, see if that’s not better.
Sounds good. Luttrell looks back at Axe and Dietz. He soft whistles an rolls his index finger, points down towards the peak belo them. Axe and Danny immediately get it. They start moving out.
PETE MUSSLEMEN, one of the four SEALs left as part of the in J-Bad, walks into the TOC. Looks to Hasslert.
Are we good?
Yes sir. They arrived about half hour ago. Should be digging in nice and tight right about now. Musslemen checks the clock on the J-Bad TOC.  31 30. Tight on clock.

Push right flank.  63. Axe the farthest right starts shooting and moving right I the wall of the Taliban flanking his right. Luttrell follows staying low, shooting, Danny firing with arm. Desperate to get the radio up.

Spartan 01 reporting major enemy contact. We need help. Spartan 01 reporting major enemy contact. Request immediate QRF! Spartan 01 requesting immediate ORF. Murphy’s doing the same with his SAT phone. He’s moving r trying to dial up the TOC. Not getting through. Danny’s left two fingers HIT. Dangling bloody and mangled He tries to put them back into his hand. Jams his ring fi back into its socket. His pinkie is beyond repair.
Marcus! Luttrell turns, Danny holds up his fucked up hand.
Wrap it up bro.
Roger that. Taliban gunfire is picking up. Axe the deepest right kill two Taliban. Two more immediately fill their positions.
Danny did you get the call through?
I made the call. Don’t know if it went through. You?
I couldn't get a line.
Fuck. Marcus is pushing right behind Axe trying to break the ri Taliban flank. Charging the Ambush.  64.

Keep pushing right. Kill ‘em all. The four SEALs fighting well as a team. Crawling, shootin and covering as they start making progress killing their into the right side of the Taliban ambush. The Taliban close enough to see clearly. Axe shot through the left shoulder. Ignoring it he keeps firing. His long scope making him very accurate. As he sh deep into the left flank.

From behind at least 12 Tabliban fighters pushing deeper the right side. Two more Taliban hit. The remaining start taking solid covering positions, firing down at the four SEALs. Axe being the closest takes the majority of the firepower Decent cover from a granite boulder which is getting hack to pieces by the incoming AK fire. Razor sharp stone shrapnel chunks slicing into Axe’s face neck. Blood runs down his face drips off his chin. Luttrell getting equally shot up. Returning fire. His cov rock getting shot up bad. Chunks of granite tearing into face and neck. FURTHER to the left, Danny and Murphy shooting, trying to closer to Luttrell and Axe. Danny takes another round, blowing clear through his righ thigh shattering his right femur. Blood, muscle chunks an bone tear through his pants.
Goddammitt. Pissed he keeps moving. Firing. Ignoring his two gunshots Hand and Leg. Danny moves up with Murphy behind some decent cover.
Can you fight?
Roger that.  65.
Want me to take the radio?
Negative. Murphy looks up towards Axe who is far right.
(yelling)
Sir!

Can we break that flank? Hold this, we’re gonna push left! Axe gets shot through the top of his shoulder the bullet tearing down through his shoulder and burning deep inside chest. Axe keeps firing, hitting a Taliban in the knee. The Tali fires back at Axe missing but sending sharp rock chips shearing up off the granite into Axe’s face. Shredding hi right ear, cutting into his eyeballs. Half blind. Watery out of focus images as sweat mixed wit blood. Axe struggles to see. When his vision clears up en to focus: AXE POV. Two Tali fighters. Moving fast out of cover, right at AXE Directly at the Americans. SEAL style. Attacking the coun attack. The Taliban are close to the half blind Axe. Axe fires bl Misses. The Taliban almost on him. Then: One of the Tali hit with a round from Luttrell, killed. T other, wounded, falls on Axe. Vicious hand-to-hand fight. Luttrell runs up to help Axe. Takes the remaining Taliban soldier out with a point-blank headshot. From the right, a BELT FED MACHINE GUN opens up on their position. Marcus and Axe start moving left. Both shot during the mo Marcus in his right butt-cheek, Axe in his right thigh.  65A.
Comms guy at radio. Checking wall clock. See’s Kristensen Shane, and some of the other Team 10 guys.
Spartan 01 is about to miss a comms second window.  66.
How long?
2 hours 15 minutes. Tight on Kristensen. Thinking. Checking the clock.
Call me if they miss two.
Roger that.
A massive barrage of gunfire erupting from the right Tali flank.
Right is no good. Murphy looks left. He can see twenty Taliban moving into firing positions.

Fuck me. The first RPG comes from the left side. Hitting just shor Danny and Murphy. Blasting them backwards. Covering them dirt and rock. Luttrell swings his gun left and starts firing into the l Taliban position.
Mikey?
Yea?
You ok?
We're good. A bullet slams in Murphy’s lower stomach. MURPHY (CONT’D) This is no good.  67.
Roger that.
Can we break that right flank?
Negative. We got to go left.

Negative. From downhill, two RPG’s fire at their position. Dietz takes a shot in his upper-right chest. A massive double RPG explosion. Tears away chunks of gran Shrapnel cutting deep into all four SEALs. They are now clearly under attack from all three sides.
We can take ‘em Mikey but I’m thinking we’re gonna need a new spot. Tight on Murphy.

Roger that. He turns behind him giving that 50 ft. cliff a second loo The Taliban gunfire is relentless now. Coming from all th sides. Luttrell, Danny and Axe returning constant fire. Reloadin mags. Firing away. Marcus hit for the first time in his r ass cheek. Tight on Murphy: MURPHY (CONT’D) We gotta fall back. Luttrell looks at the cliff behind them.
You mean fall off.
Roger that. Fall off. Danny can you move?
No problem.
Axe?

Good to go. As the four shot up SEALs turn and start to move fast tow the edge of the cliff. The pitch causing them to run and start falling immediately. Danny’s legs giving out, buckl as he hurls himself up and over the ledge. Marcus turns to Murphy. Luttrell, Murphy and Axe do the same. For a second they l like four country boys cliff jumping into a lake. Except the blood streaming from necks and guts and legs, the bul tracers flying all around them... They fly off the cliff and it looks kind of beautiful. Freeing...until.

Bone crushing. Concussive. Violent beyond words. Human bo smashing into rock. Tearing through trees. Bouncing. Brok bones and smashed faces. Helmets fly off. The SEALs crash bounce and flip. Finally settling hard on a reasonably fl part of the cliff. 300 yards below.
Tight on Luttrell. Face down. The first to move. Face lifts. Nose clearly broken. Luttrell looks to his le Murphy struggling to his knees. Broken teeth. Face shredd To the right, Danny and Axe.
Hey Marcus.
Yes sir.
That sucked.
Yes sir.
I mean that really sucked.
Yes sir. Voices screaming up the mountain.
Taraq is at the jump point looking down the steep cliff. Feels unsurvivable. Several fierce lieutenants flanking S
Go. Dozens of Taliban start making their way down the steep cliff.
Murphy, Marcus Axe and Dietz struggling to their feet.
Fuck. Luttrell sees the blood pouring from Murphy’s gut.
Let me see it. Pulling up Murphy’s shirt revealing a decent gut shot. Ma looks for his med kit. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Lost my med kit.
Where’s your gun? Luttrell looks down. To his left, then right. Spots his g ten feet away in the dirt.
God's looking out for us.
If this is looking out for us I don’t want to see him pissed.
We're doing good Mikey we just gotta... Luttrell interrupted by a series of severe incoming RPG's Blasting all around them. Luttrell and Murphy dive behind some fallen trees. Lookin up.
We just got to get off this hill.

Shah's Taliban are slowly moving down the cliff. Not near as fast as the SEALs fall. But they are definitely coming ON LUTTRELL and MURPHY. LOG HIDE. 48F Returning fire. Picking off a couple of Taliban but revea their position. More incoming RPG’s tearing into the cove trees. Trees start burning. A metal hook - RPG debris - spears into Luttrell’s right side. He keeps firing when from the left... A LOUD CRASHING. Two bodies falling hard. Axe and Danny. Falling hard like Murphy and Luttrell. Sianming, flipping, landing 50 ft to the right of the tre Axe shot up getting to his feet. The Taliban shooting dow him. MURPHY (CONT’D) Axe! Here! Move it buddy. Run! Axe sees Murphy behind the trees. Charges to the hide.  71.

This sucks. No hesitation - Axe slams a fresh magazine into his M4 st firing up the hill. Marcus is looking back to Danny. Danny is dead still. No movement. Axe provides cover as Luttrell and Murphy, dodging RPG’s a hailstorm of AK fire, grabbing an alive but seriously fucked up Danny. Picking Danny up they start hauling him back to the tree cover. TIGHT on Danny as a Bullet slams through his right rib ca

(eyes tight, through mashed teeth) Goddamn this sucks. Luttrell and Murphy slam into the tree hide propping Dann up. The four SEALs back together ready to fight. Marcus tryin to treat Danny; pulling out his Burst Kit Danny recovering staring down at his blood-soaked hand, dazed, looks to Marcus
Marcus, I’m shot.
We are all shot bro, can you fight? Danny stares back down at his bleeding, mangled hand, the his gun.

(muttering to himself) Mess up my drawing hand, that pisses me off. Danny raises his gun uphill, takes aim at a Taliban fight jumping from rock to rock. Danny fires killing the Taliba Re-aims, fires, kills a second. Re-aims, fires, kills a third. Looks to Marcus.
I can fight.
The SEALS now packed into a burning LOG HIDE fighting as as they can from inferior position.
Taliban starting to re-mass. Dialing in on the SEALs position. Thirty AK-47's firing down on the SEALs.
The SEALs getting sprayed. A ceiling of AK fire. The SEAL flat on their backs. SEAL POV. AK tracers streak over head. MURPHY has his face next to Dietz.
I tried ‘em at least three times boss.
Nothing?
Nothing. Murphy and Dietz both take rounds. Danny in the foot. Three of Murphy’s right toes blow off. His boot leaking blood. Murphy returning fire. Hot brass shell casings falling in his shirt.
Dammit! Murphy getting the brass out of his shirt. MURPHY (CONT’D) Goddamnitt! Danny screaming in pain. Eyes pouring tears.
Danny?  73.
This really sucks man. Really fucking sucks. Fucking burning inside bro. Axe and Luttrell trying to fire over the logs. Luttrell h a grenade. Taliban with RPG’s moving into firing position.
We gotta move! As the first RPG blows into the side of the log hide. Wood daggers and burning embers explode and rip through clothes and skin.

Move left! Left! Axe and Luttrell start moving out. Dietz struggling to get up, radio pulling him backwards. Murphy reaches back for Dietz. MURPHY (CONT’D) Give me a hand Danny. Danny dazed stares up at Murphy.
Come on buddy! We got to move. A second RPG demolishes the hide. Fully exposing Murphy a Dietz. Murphy yanks Dietz to his feet.
Right now bro.

I’m with you. Murphy fires up the hill.  487 74. Dietz grinds it out following Luttrell. Murphy lays out more cover fire, then turns and moves aft the three SEALs. SIDE OF MOUNTAIN. Ravine. 487 Tight shots of the four SEALs scrambling for their lives. Bleeding, spit, sweat, snot, tears as they claw their way across the burning mountain. This is a sequence. Watching the men run. Legs buckling. caps smashing on rock. Slipping falling helping each othe Incoming rounds tearing past them. Daytime trace fire. The SEALs charge across the side of the mountain. Breathing is hysteric. High-pitched wheezing and gagging. They are literally running cross a burning mountain for t lives. Luttrell first to stop. Tight on Luttrell.
Gotta fucking rest. Axe collapses next to him, then Murphy, then Dietz. All f SEALs gasping and choking for air. A moment of desperate attempts to get air.
Need some water.
We got to get to the village. Got to.
Got to.

Fuck. Dietz is by far the worst. Trying to breath. Blood loss starting to weaken him. Murphy pulls out his sat phone, tries to get a signal.  49 50 75. Tight on Each SEAL. Burning. Sucking air. Luttrell stares Dietz. Hold this for a couple of beats. A brief silence. A pause
This is bad....
Kristensen watching clock. Drinking coffee.
That’s the second window.

Correct. Clear tension in the TOC. A half dozen SEALs gathered in the TOC. Kristensen picks up phone. Dials the large force special TOC (Base control) Intercut with Kristensen and CO of JOC. Kristensen lettin know that he’s missed two windows of contact with Spartan
Back tight on four SEALs. Still silent, trying to recover Then. Sounds of the Taliban yelling. Communicating as they star get closer. Luttrell looks over to Dietz. Whispering.
How you feeling Danny?
Shot me up pretty good bro.
You’re good Danny. Axe, Murphy, Luttrell, counting mags and grenades. Trying to compose themselves. Luttrell packing dirt into Danny’s gun shot wounds.

Looks back to Murphy. Everyone whispering. Trying to stay as quiet as possible. Taliban has lost them. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Pack ‘em with dirt. Tight. Murphy literally balling up dirt and jamming it into his guts. Trying to plug the blood flow.

With Taraq and his men as they move through the mountain. Searching for the SEALs. SEALs HIDING IN ROCK QUARRY 50B Dead quiet. Alert. Luttrell moves Axe checking his wounds. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) You're okay. Danny blurts out. Loud voice.
How'd they get on us so fast Mikey? Murphy and Axe on him. Hands around his mouth.
Shhhhhh. Danny Shhhhhh. Silence. The SEALs wait, tense.

Taraq reacts to the sound of Danny’s voice. Signals to his men. They start moving in on the SEALs SEALs IN THE ROCK QUARRY: 50D Axe slowly removing his hand from Danny’s mouth. Danny looking up wide eyed at Murphy.
Mike?
You got to be quiet Danny.
(whispering) I know. I just can’t get over how fast they are.
Yea.
Faster than we are.
They might be.
Mike how did they get on us so fast?
Don’t know. Don’t get it. Dietz is starting to lose it.
Got on us pretty fast. I was talking to my mom, she didn’t say anything about it. Matty you see them?
I didn’t see until you did Danny.
So much fucking red man. Really vivid reds. Taliban voices growing louder. Luttrell looks to Murphy.
We got to move Mike.

The only option for movement is down. Another 80 ft. drop The rocks above Axelson start to shear. Incoming rounds. Above them silhouetted Taliban fighters. The team once again surrounded. Murphy starring down the cliff.  78.
Axe, how shot up are you? Axe looking down at himself. Inventorying his bullet woun
I think three times. I’m hit three... I don’t know what this is. Blood oozing from the back of his head. Behind his right
Are you good to move?
Move where?
We're going down. Axe looks downhill. AXE’s POV Another massive drop. Sharp Granite, trees, and a brutal pitch.
Hoo-yah to that Murph.

Over the back of Taraq, fighters on both sides. Slow mo a they move fast through, in front of them the ravine hidin the SEALs. Tight on Taraq. Smelling blood. Rage and hatred filled eyes. The Taliban fighters, like Apache warriors, picking up sp Guns up.
Murphy looks to Marcus.
Marcus, you good?
Yes sir.

Danny? Incoming rounds starting to pick up intensity. The granit starting to vaporize all around them. Danny clicking back into a primal warrior mode. Up on his knees firing back. Marcus reaching for Danny pulling him down back into cove
I got him. Murphy looks over the rock hide. MURPHY’S POV. Taraq with six fighters charging out of the tree line. Al AK's blasting.

Go! Go! Go! Move! Murphy pulling off the clip of a FRAG GRENADE. Hurls it a the charging Taliban as: Axe leaps off the cliff. 53A Murphy turns. Leaps. The grenade DETONATES. Killing two Taliban. Shah continues to charge. Luttrell hoists Dietz up and over his shoulder. Turning towards the cliff. He turns to fire a last burst Taraq. Marcus digs his back foot into the loose slate, ready to when: Taraq FIRES. Danny shot through the neck. Bullet passes through Danny’s neck tearing through the si of Luttrell’s neck. Luttrell screams in pain spinning, dropping Danny.
LUTTRELL and DIETZ separate. Danny falling onto the rock. Luttrell falling backwards off the cliff.

Another brutal fall. SMASHING BACKWARDS DOWN THE CLIFF. Luttrell tries grabbing for dirt, tree, or rock. Anything slow his fall. He slams through trees snapping thick branches. Bouncing rock. Luttrell disappears into the lower tree, brush line below

On his back. M4 by his side. Taraq and his fighters move in. More Taliban clearing the tree line behind them. Taraq looks down at Dietz’s body. Turns and looks down the cliff. Taraq reaches down, picks up Dietz’s M4. Looks it over. Reaches back down. Takes one of Danny’s Grenades.
Luttrell on his side struggling to get to his knees. Murp twenty feet away with Axe below him. MURPHY (CONT’D) Where’s Danny?
Taraq pulls the pin on Dietz’s grenade. Hurls it down hil the direction of the three remaining SEALs.
His grenade comes in short. Blowing rock chunks and dirt the three SEALs.  54 55 81. MURPHY (CONT’D) Where the fuck is Danny?
Tight on the watch clock. ZULU time. Kristensen staring at it. Tapping his fingers on the tabl
Try them again. Comms guy in the back of the room keys his radio mic.
Spartan 01, this is Anvil 1, do you copy? Spartan 01 do you copy? Radio Silence.
Luttrell looking over to Murphy.
We got to get him. More grenades. RPG’s. Noise is deafening.
What?
We got to get him. The three guys trying to communicate. All talking over ea other.
Where’s Danny? I can’t see him.
How do you know he’s dead?
Danny’s dead.
Where?
His fucking head blew off?  82.
Do you have Danny?
In my fucking arms.
We got to get down. Deafening EXPLOSIONS.
We got to get up there and get him.
We got to get down now.
Do you know where he is? AXE MOVES CLOSER.
Is Danny hit?
Yes.
Where is he hit?
In the head.
Where is he?
Up on top.
We got to get him. More explosions.
Let’s move right. Take the flank right. See if we can get back up there.
We'll get Danny. Get him down with us. Get off this hill. Take them on the flat ground.
Taraq now with twenty fighters. Firing down hill. Throwin grenades. Ordering his men down the sides of the cliff.
I think we can take them on the flat ground.
Let’s move. How much ammo do we have. Guys checking magazines.
I got seventy rounds. Three grenades.
Fifty rounds. One grenade.
I got three full mags. Five Grenades.
Let’s suck it up that fucking hill.
Roger that.
Roger that.

Move. The three SEALs, guns up, firing up hill. As they attempt get back up to Danny. EXT. DANNY’S POSITION (CLIFF ABOVE QUARRY) 56 He’s not dead. Close. Shah, Taraq and his men staring ove him as he struggles back to his knees. Staring up at Tara through blood soaked eyes, broken, dying. Defiant. Danny refusing to go gently...His right hand fumbling for his f knife in his front pocket. Taraq just stares at Danny’s broken mangled fingers tryin open his knife. Drops it.

Danny looks down past his knife. The “Tile” samples page fallen out of his pocket. Blood stained. Danny stares at paper. Taraq slowly lifts his foot, pushes against Dietz’s chest Pushes him back down flat on his back.. Tight on Dietz dying, staring up at Taraq. Dietz slowly raises his blood soaked right hand up to Taraq.

Murphy is out in front. Clawing his way into the left sid the descending Taliban flank. Luttrell and Axe trying to lay down cover fire, shooting at Shah’s soldiers as they move down the right side of th Mountain. Even the Taliban are having a slow go of it on account of radical pitch. TIGHT WITH MURPHY. A leader desperately trying to make his way straight into teeth of the enemy to recover one of his men. A torrent of incoming gunfire blocking his advances. Luttrell twenty feet to his right trying to do the same. Axe staying below. Firing up the hill. HITS two TALIBAN a they move down the hill towards Murphy and Luttrell. ON LUTTRELL. The incoming fire has him pinned against a rock. He is desperate to find a way back up the hill. Peering around each side of the giant boulder. TWENTY FEET to his left Murphy is doing the same. They start moving and covering for each other. One shoots while the other moves fast to a higher covering rock. This is a desperate, clawing uphill mountain scramble. Tw men, like animals brutally determined to reclaim their fa brother. Tight on their hands, eyes, feet, sweat, blood and tears they crawl their way, inch by inch back up this brutal ro mountain.  85. They are able to ascend about thirty feet before they run of cover. MURPHY and LUTTRELL side by side. Bullets exploding all around them. Murphy’s got SAT phone out again trying to get a signal. got no line of sight. Can’t make the call.
I don’t know Mikey.
There’s just so fucking many of them.
I don’t think we can get him.
Fuck.
We got to get down.
Yea.

Got to get to flat ground. Tight on Murphy taking in the entire situation. Taliban a around them. His gun shots. Axe. Down hill fighting. Cove them. Murphy studies the terrain. A jagged rock peak sticking o in the clear about fifty feet to his left.
I know.
We can’t get him Mikey.
We can get him.
We're gonna die if we don’t get off this mountain.
We’re gonna get him.  86. Murphy’s fixated on the exposed rock area fifty feet abov him. He looks down hill to Axe. Desperately trying to keep the Taliban from getting at Luttrell and Murphy.
I’m gonna get us some help Marcus.
Mike, they’re coming straight above you and to your right. Murphy, SAT phone in hand, looks below to Marcus.
I’m gonna get this call out.
Good luck on that one brother.
Marcus, look at me. Luttrell turns locks eyes with Murphy.
I’m gonna make the call. Marcus looks past Murphy to the clear rock face above him Luttrell gets what Murphy is saying, what he’s about to d
I'm sorry Mike.
For what bro? Marcus takes a beat, looks away, then back at Murphy.
That we haven’t killed more of ‘em.
Oh we’re gonna kill more of them. Bet on that Marcus. We’re gonna kill a lot more of them.

Roger that. Murphy digs into his pack, has three remaining mags, hand them to Luttrell. Luttrell slides them into his vest. Mur checks his M4, SAT phone in his left hand, M4 in his righ  57 87. He turns to Marcus, tears in both of their eyes.
Never out of the fight Marcus.

Never. Murphy turns, pushes up and simply stands. Completely exposed. He starts running uphill to the exposed rock, hitting send on the SAT phone. Luttrell and Axe lay down cover as Murph charges up the h taking repeated rounds. Legs, arms, guts, Murphy makes it the clearing, the SAT connection locks in. Murphy sits on rock oblivious to the incoming rounds. INT. TOC —- J-BAD 57 In the TOC a SAT phone rings. Hasslert, sitting by the communications equipment, stares at it, picks it up.
J-Bad TOC -- ON THE MOUNTAIN, MURPHY’S CLEAR ROCK FACE.
Sir this is Lieutenant Mike Murphy. Spartan 01. We need immediate air support, immediate air support. Hasslert freezes for a microsecond. Then.
Roger Murphy. Can I have your ten digit grid. Hasslert hears gunfire and Murphy impaired breathing.
(vo on phone) We need help now! Need immediate CAS.
Roger that, I need your ten digit grid.

(vo on phone) We are headed down the ravine toward the Chichakel village.  58 88. Hasslert immediately on his computer firing on the secure intercut comms link, “micro chat”. Tight on Screen. As he types TIC! Troops in contact!
Murphy can you get me the grids?
Please hurry. Sir. Thank you. In the TOC men start looking over as Hasslert types in th call for help.
Jesus, I think we need the QRF. Tight on the computer screen, ‘Troops in Contact’ ‘Murphy in Trouble’. Tight on Erik Kristensen, eyes wide...reading the call fo help. He grabs the phone.

Let’s move guys. Let’s really move! EXT. MOUNTAIN - MURPHY’S CLEARING 58 Back to Murphy, SAT phone dead. He turns faces up hill as bullets rip into his chest. He keeps firing. Murphy starts moving up hill firing into the Taliban mass It’s a suicide march... Luttrell falls back to Axe as Murphy, multiple gun shots keeps firing. Murphy falls to his knees, screaming in pain...as Taragq his soldiers move in. Murphy slams his final magazine, blood pouring through hi NYFD patch, running down both arms. Murphy raises his M4, last full auto burst, hits three Taliban, as a final shot slams through the front of Murphy’s face blowing him backwards, completely flipping him head over heels landin his face.
Eyes still open Murphy’s last vision is his Iridium SAT phone. He can die knowing that he was able to make the ca

Marines and SEALs scramble collecting weapons, sprinting the Blackhawks, Air Force pilots climbing into the Blackh firing engines. Track with Navy SEALs. Pete Musslemen stuffing magazines his vest, charging for a Blackhawk.
Tracking with Erik Kristensen, Dan Healy, James Suh as SE charge towards waiting 47's.
Nightstalker pilots and flight crew working feverishly to fire up the powerful Chinook engines. It's clearly all hands on deck as the helicopters are pac with SEALs armed to the teeth.

I said let’s move! Track with Kristensen on the Chinook up to the pilot. The nightstalker pilot and Kristensen frantically confirm location waypoint of where they think the recon team shou logically be. CUT WIDE: As the two Chinooks loaded with SEALs lift.
The Blackhawk about to take off, when HASSLERT sprints ac the runway, charging to the lead Blackhawk, shaking his h eyes locked on Blackhawk pilot screaming,

head_text.subj: NO GO, NO GO, NO GO

text: Door flying open, Pete Musslemen heads out.  62 63 64 90.
What’s the fucking problem? Hasslert charging toward Musslemen.
You’re grounded.
What are you fucking talking about?
You’re grounded, you have no Apache support. Blackhawks can’t go in without air cover. Musslemen looking around realizing the Apaches are not th
Where the fuck are the Apaches?
We are trying to figure that out.
Where are the fucking Apaches?!!

Kristensen’s lead 47. Kristensen is up with the Nightstal pilot. In the back of the chopper, packed, almost overflowing wi SEALs, the men check weapons. The Airforce Nightstalker pilots checking their 50 calibe side guns. Everyone silent and intense.
Musslemen out of his Blackhawk in the face of Hasslert  65
(screaming) Where are they?
They're coming back.
When?
On their way now!
When will they fucking be here?
15 minutes.
Are you fucking kidding me?
Marcus scrambling back with Axe, jammed behind rocks, tak heavy, heavy fire. Marcus digs in side by side with Axe. Both men shot up, l like hell.
Where’s Murphy? Luttrell doesn’t answer.
Where's Mike?
Up top.
Where up fucking top?
He’s getting the ORF. The incoming gunfire stopping. An eerie silence coming ov the hill. Just random Taliban voices. Calm. Distant.  66 92.
What the fuck is going on?
I don’t know.
Where exactly is Mikey?
I don’t know. More tears pouring down Axe and Luttrell’s faces. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) We gotta get down.
Did he make the call?
I don’t know....we got to get off this hill Axe.
Do you think he made the call? Axe and Marcus staring into each other.
The two Chinook 47's, hauling ass. Back ramp open, Kriste standing over it. He looks ready to jump right now. Kristensen looks down a the steep mountains, back up to the following 47.
(on radio) What’s the problem? INTERCUT with Musslemen on the grounded Blackhawk in J-Ba
(radio) The Apaches were pulled.
(radio) Why?  93.
(radio) Some army troops in contact.
(radio) Where are they?
They're saying 10 minutes out. Kristensen moving up to the pilots of his 47. Plugs into 47 comms.
What’s the deal with the Apaches? The Blackhawks are grounded at J- Bad.
Roger that. Blackhawks need the air support.
They should have boots on ground right the fuck now.
Roger that.
What the fuck is the problem?
Not enough air assets in theatre, that’s the fucking problem.
What’s our fucking ETA?
15 minutes.
Where are the Apaches?
25 minutes.
Can you put us down without the Apaches?  67
Not supposed to.
Will you put us down? Pilot pauses...looks to Kristensen.
We'll do whatever we have to do to get you with your men.
Thank you.
Luttrell and Axe trying to quietly climb their way down t mountain. Still a couple of hundred feet above the villag They are climbing, falling 10-20 ft. falls.
Taragq tracking them. Shah, higher up communicating on ra
The two 47's. The 2nd 47 flies past Kristensen, taking th lead.
(misc comms) 1st 47 will fly over LZ make sure it’s clear. Kristensen’s 47 will be 1st to hover.
The two Apaches show up. Tearing over the airfield. Hellf missile arrays and 40 mm front mounted getting guns.  70
The Blackhawks finally take off following the Apaches.

Tracking tight with Taraq. His worn sandaled feet slowly stepping down the mountain. He’s following blood drops. Tight on beaded stone necklace with seven American Dog Ta hanging from it like human scalps.
